taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in small, mostly swampy brooks in the rainforest (Ref. 3788).  Not a seasonal killifish.  Is very difficult to maintain in aquarium (Ref. 27139).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Moelants, T., Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T. 2010. Aphyosemion georgiae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: A Lower Guinea endemic, found in the Ivindo River drainage system, between Koumameyong and Bélinga in northern Gabon. The Ivindo river drains an area of 11,770 km².

dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Moelants, T., Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T.

Reviewer/s
Snoeks, J., Collen, B., Darwall, W.R.T., Ram, M., Smith, K. & Allen, D.J.

Contributor/s

Justification
Although Aphyosemion georgiae has a relatively limited distribution, it is listed as Least Concern because there are currently no threats known to the species, it inhabits a relatively remote and undisturbed area, in which some parts are protected and receiving conservation attention.

History
  • 2009
    Least Concern
  • 2007
    Least Concern
    (IUCN 2009.2)
